item.title: EV charger Outside Manor Mansions, 28th October
item.description:
This EV Charger run by a company called Charge Europe is faulty. It allows customers to connect but fails to charge the vehicle. As a result the company charges fees for just connecting to the charger while not providing the service they advertise as available from the charger.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Belsize Grove, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Glaring light left on by builders, 28th October
item.description:
Since Thursday 23 October. Builders have left on the industrial lights in the art workshop 7 CS. This light penetrates our building (we're only 10M away) causing us to be unable to sleep. The lights need to be turned off inside but the building is locked

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clarence Mews, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned car parked on drive for over a year, 28th October
item.description:
This car has been parked on the drive of 26 Sibthorpe Road for over a year. Issue was first reported October 2024, previous update referred it to be a police matter but following contacting the police they have declared it to be a council matter. The car has been declared SORN alongside an expired MOT, but there is no way for me to find or contact the owner. To be clear the owner does not live at and is not affiliated in anyway shape or form with the address the car has been left. It has been untouched for over a calendar year and has been an obstruction to building works and general access to the home. It would be appreciated if this matter is dealt with urgently.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sibthorpe Road, Horn Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping at end of Dunlop Place, 28th October
item.description:
The area past the tree at the end of Dunlop Place is constantly being used for fly tipping and it is getting worse as the months go on. As soon as it is cleared up a new pile appears. This pile appeared on Saturday night 26/10/25

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dunlop Place, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Thus us what a street looks like 5 mins after the street cleaners have left., 28th October
item.description:
The street cleaners arrived the first time in months. The used a blower to get the leaves into the air so that they go over peoples walls into their gardens the rest was swept into a pile and just left. So no rubbish removed at all. Also you may check that the van comes to our road but the workers sit in it for 25 mins and dont get out and then drive off. That's the way to beat the tracker

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St. Nicholas Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
